main event: Three disc-like objects were sighted in Charleston, Maine on 29 May 1960, appearing as bright flashes at one-mile intervals.
interesting points: The objects were described as round and basketball-sized and emitted bright flashes upon appearance., One object seemed to move from the ground, while the others appeared at one-minute intervals., The sighting lasted for 3 minutes and involved three objects moving south., The source of the report was military, and the observer was Richard Hawkins, a reliable witness., The report speculated that the sighted objects were probably the planet Mars, influenced by refraction.
witness description: Richard Hawkins, A/3C, Air Police, reliable
